name: Auto-generate Tests on Save
description: Automatically generate or update unit tests when implementation files are saved
prompt:
A source file was just saved at {{filePath}}. Analyze this file and:

1. Check if a corresponding test file exists (same name with .test.ts or .test.tsx extension)
2. If no test file exists, create one with comprehensive unit tests covering:
   - All exported functions and methods
   - Edge cases and error handling
   - TypeScript type safety
   - Mock external dependencies appropriately
3. If a test file exists, review it and:
   - Add tests for any new functions/methods not yet covered
   - Update existing tests if function signatures changed
   - Ensure test coverage is comprehensive

Follow these testing standards:
- Use Vitest as the test framework
- Use @testing-library/react for React components
- Aim for 80%+ code coverage
- Write descriptive test names using 'should' or 'it' patterns
- Group related tests with describe blocks
- Mock API calls and external dependencies
- Test both success and failure scenarios

Do NOT run the tests, just create/update the test file. Keep tests focused and minimal per our testing guidelines.
